trans-unit.source: A tile is an app's representation on the Start menu.
trans-unit.target: A tile is an app's representation on the Start menu.

trans-unit.source: Every app has a tile.
trans-unit.target: Every app has a tile.

trans-unit.source: When you create a new Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app project in Microsoft Visual Studio, it includes a default tile that displays your app's name and logo.
trans-unit.target: When you create a new Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app project in Microsoft Visual Studio, it includes a default tile that displays your app's name and logo.

trans-unit.source: Tiles
trans-unit.target: Tiles

trans-unit.source: Tiles for UWP apps
trans-unit.target: Tiles for UWP apps

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: A *tile* is an app's representation on the Start menu.
trans-unit.target: A *tile* is an app's representation on the Start menu.

trans-unit.source: Every app has a tile.
trans-unit.target: Every app has a tile.

trans-unit.source: When you create a new Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app project in Microsoft Visual Studio, it includes a default tile that displays your app's name and logo.
trans-unit.target: When you create a new Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app project in Microsoft Visual Studio, it includes a default tile that displays your app's name and logo.

trans-unit.source: Windows displays this tile when your app is first installed.
trans-unit.target: Windows displays this tile when your app is first installed.

trans-unit.source: After your app is installed, you can change your tile's content through notifications; for example, you can change the tile to communicate new information to the user, such as news headlines, or the subject of the most recent unread message.
trans-unit.target: After your app is installed, you can change your tile's content through notifications; for example, you can change the tile to communicate new information to the user, such as news headlines, or the subject of the most recent unread message.

trans-unit.source: Configure the default tile
trans-unit.target: Configure the default tile

trans-unit.source: When you create a new project in Visual Studio, it creates a simple default tile that displays your app's name and logo.
trans-unit.target: When you create a new project in Visual Studio, it creates a simple default tile that displays your app's name and logo.

trans-unit.source: There are a few items you should update:
trans-unit.target: There are a few items you should update:

trans-unit.source: DisplayName: Replace this value with the name you want to display on your tile.
trans-unit.target: DisplayName: Replace this value with the name you want to display on your tile.

trans-unit.source: ShortName: Because there is limited room for your display name to fit on tiles, we recommend that you to specify a ShortName as well, to make sure your app's name doesn’t get truncated.
trans-unit.target: ShortName: Because there is limited room for your display name to fit on tiles, we recommend that you to specify a ShortName as well, to make sure your app's name doesn’t get truncated.

trans-unit.source: Logo images:
trans-unit.target: Logo images:

trans-unit.source: You should replace these images with your own.
trans-unit.target: You should replace these images with your own.

trans-unit.source: You have the option of supplying images for different visual scales, but you are not required to supply them all.
trans-unit.target: You have the option of supplying images for different visual scales, but you are not required to supply them all.

trans-unit.source: To ensure that you app looks good on a range of devices, we recommend that you provide 100%, 200%, and 400% scale versions of each image.
trans-unit.target: To ensure that you app looks good on a range of devices, we recommend that you provide 100%, 200%, and 400% scale versions of each image.

trans-unit.source: Scaled images follow this naming convention:
trans-unit.target: Scaled images follow this naming convention:

trans-unit.source: *<image name>*.scale-*<scale factor>*.*<image file extension>*
trans-unit.target: *<image name>*.scale-*<scale factor>*.*<image file extension>*

trans-unit.source: For example: SmallLogo.scale-100.png
trans-unit.target: For example: SmallLogo.scale-100.png

trans-unit.source: When you refer to the image, you refer to it as *<image name>*.*<image file extension>* ("SmallLogo.png" in this example).
trans-unit.target: When you refer to the image, you refer to it as *<image name>*.*<image file extension>* ("SmallLogo.png" in this example).

trans-unit.source: The system will automatically select the appropriate scaled image for the device from the images you've provided.
trans-unit.target: The system will automatically select the appropriate scaled image for the device from the images you've provided.

trans-unit.source: You don't have to, but we highly recommend supplying logos for wide and large tile sizes so that the user can resize your app's tile to those sizes.
trans-unit.target: You don't have to, but we highly recommend supplying logos for wide and large tile sizes so that the user can resize your app's tile to those sizes.

trans-unit.source: To provide these additional images, you create a `DefaultTile` element and use the `Wide310x150Logo` and `Square310x310Logo` attributes to specify the additional images:
trans-unit.target: To provide these additional images, you create a `DefaultTile` element and use the `Wide310x150Logo` and `Square310x310Logo` attributes to specify the additional images:

trans-unit.source: Use notifications to customize your tile
trans-unit.target: Use notifications to customize your tile

trans-unit.source: After your app is installed, you can use notifications to customize your tile.
trans-unit.target: After your app is installed, you can use notifications to customize your tile.

trans-unit.source: You can do this the first time your app launches or in response to some event, such as a push notification.
trans-unit.target: You can do this the first time your app launches or in response to some event, such as a push notification.

trans-unit.source: Create an XML payload (in the form of an [**Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.XmlDocument**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br206173)) that describes the tile.
trans-unit.target: Create an XML payload (in the form of an [**Windows.Data.Xml.Dom.XmlDocument**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br206173)) that describes the tile.

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 introduces a new adaptive tile schema you can use.
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 introduces a new adaptive tile schema you can use.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Adaptive tiles](tiles-and-notifications-create-adaptive-tiles.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Adaptive tiles](tiles-and-notifications-create-adaptive-tiles.md).

trans-unit.source: For the schema, see the [Adaptive tiles schema](tiles-and-notifications-adaptive-tiles-schema.md).
trans-unit.target: For the schema, see the [Adaptive tiles schema](tiles-and-notifications-adaptive-tiles-schema.md).

trans-unit.source: You can use the Windows 8.1 tile templates to define your tile.
trans-unit.target: You can use the Windows 8.1 tile templates to define your tile.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Creating tiles and badges (Windows 8.1)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh868260).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Creating tiles and badges (Windows 8.1)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh868260).

trans-unit.source: Create a tile notification object and pass it the [**XmlDocument**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br206173) you created.
trans-unit.target: Create a tile notification object and pass it the [**XmlDocument**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br206173) you created.

trans-unit.source: There are several types of notification objects:
trans-unit.target: There are several types of notification objects:

trans-unit.source: A [**Windows.UI.NotificationsTileNotification**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208616) object for updating the tile immediately.
trans-unit.target: A [**Windows.UI.NotificationsTileNotification**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208616) object for updating the tile immediately.

trans-unit.source: A [**Windows.UI.Notifications.ScheduledTileNotification**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701637) object for updating the tile at some point in the future.
trans-unit.target: A [**Windows.UI.Notifications.ScheduledTileNotification**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701637) object for updating the tile at some point in the future.

trans-unit.source: Use the [**Windows.UI.Notifications.TileUpdateManager.CreateTileUpdaterForApplication**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208623) to create a [**TileUpdater**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208628) object.
trans-unit.target: Use the [**Windows.UI.Notifications.TileUpdateManager.CreateTileUpdaterForApplication**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208623) to create a [**TileUpdater**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208628) object.

trans-unit.source: Call the [**TileUpdater.Update**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208632) method and pass it the tile notification object you created in step 2.
trans-unit.target: Call the [**TileUpdater.Update**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208632) method and pass it the tile notification object you created in step 2.
